Key Match Events: Anthony Davis scored 35 points, Austin Reaves added 26, and the Los Angeles Lakers rallied to beat the Phoenix Suns 123-116.
LeBron James had 17 of his 21 points in the second half for the Lakers.
Kevin Durant led Phoenix with 30 points. Devin Booker had 23.
The Lakers were down 61-52 at halftime, then outscored Phoenix 35-24 in the third quarter to take the lead.
Los Angeles led by 12 points in the fourth quarter.
The Lakers trailed 81-74 with three minutes left in the third quarter before scoring nine straight points to grab the lead.
The Lakers were 14 of 27 on 3-pointers. Reaves was 5 of 7 from beyond the arc while James, Dalton Knecht, and Rui Hachimura made two apiece.
Miscellaneous Highlights: JJ Reddick is the first Los Angeles coach to win his first two games since Phil Jackson in 1999.
